title: Chord: 11th in F (Shape: C)
content:
# Chord: 11th in F (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The 11th chord in F played using the C shape is an interesting and complex chord voicing that adds color and depth to your harmonic progressions. It is rich in overtones and can bring a jazzy or soulful flavor to your music. 

## Notes and Intervals
- F (Root)
- A (Major 3rd)
- C (Perfect 5th)
- G (Major 9th)
- D (Perfect 11th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 11th chord in F played using the C shape is often used in jazz, R&B, soul, and funk genres. It adds a sophisticated and lush sound to your compositions, creating a sense of tension and resolution. This chord voicing works well as a substitute for a standard dominant or major chord, adding a modern and expressive touch to your music.

## Songs
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis:** This iconic jazz tune features the 11th chord extensively, showcasing its versatility and melodic possibilities.
2. **"I Wish" by Stevie Wonder:** In this funky R&B track, the 11th chord adds a soulful and groovy vibe to the chord progressions.
3. **"Watermelon Man" by Herbie Hancock:** A jazz-funk classic, this song prominently uses the 11th chord in F (Shape: C) to create a dynamic and engaging musical landscape.
